original_title: An Open Source Mobile Phone Based on the ESP32
original_content:
As microcontrollers become ever faster and cheaper, something weve been expecting has been an open source smartphone based not upon a high-end chip, but on a cheap commodity one. In the electronic badge arena weve come pretty close, but perhaps its left to [Gabriel Rochet] to deliver the first one that brings everything together. His Paxo phone is now on version 4, and while the French-language website link stubbornly resists translation with Google translate, English speakers can find a description of its capabilities along with the software in a GitHub repository.
The hardware is surprisingly straightforward, with a resistive touch screen and a PCB featuring power management, an ESP32 main processor, and a GSM module. The 2G connectivity may not be the fastest, or even available in your country, but otherwise the feature set looks more than reasonable for a basic mobile phone.
We like this project a lot, because as we said it starts to deliver on the promise of the 2018 EMF badge and the 2022 MCH badge. We think the former badges designers might find something of interest in it.
Thanks [DarkBrines] for the tip.
title: 安価なマイコンを使用したオープンソーススマートフォン「Paxo phone」が登場
body: 安価なチップを使用したオープンソースのスマートフォン、Paxo phoneが進化しました。主な機能とソフトウェアの説明はGitHubで入手可能です。基本的な携帯電話としては優れた機能を持っています。
titles: 安価なマイコンを使用したオープンソーススマートフォン「Paxo phone」が登場
Microcontrollersがますます高速・安価になる中、低価格なチップを使用したオープンソーススマートフォンが開発される
ESP32メインプロセッサとGSMモジュールを搭載した「Paxo phone」、基本的な携帯電話として十分な機能を備える
2018 EMFバッジや2022 MCHバッジの約束を実現するプロジェクト「Paxo phone」が注目を集める
電子工作愛好者必見！「Paxo phone」のGitHubリポジトリにはソフトウェアと機能の詳細が掲載されている
